alert.note: Alert for Barnstable; Dukes; Eastern Essex; Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Nantucket; Suffolk (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 29 at 3:50AM EST until January 30 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EST THIS MORNING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Warning, one to two feet of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways (3.1 to 13.7 feet Mean Lower Low Water). For the Coastal Flood Advisory, up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected in low- lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways (3.0 to 10.7 feet Mean Lower Low Water). * WHERE...Eastern Essex MA, Suffolk MA, Eastern Norfolk MA, Eastern Plymouth MA, Barnstable MA, Dukes MA and Nantucket MA Counties. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Warning, until 11 AM EST this morning. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 7 PM this evening to midnight EST tonight. * IMPACTS...Coastal flooding is expected along the North Shore from Gloucester to Newburyport. Wave action will likely cause some washover onto coastal roads around the time of high tide. Moderate flooding of Nantucket Harbor is expected. Some low- lying coastal roads, including Easy and Easton Streets, will experience flooding during the time nearest high tide. Minor coastal flooding occurs along Morrissey Boulevard in Boston. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...storm surge of 2.0 to 2.5 ft is expected during the morning high tide. This combined with building waves on top of the storm surge, will increase the risk for areas of moderate coastal flooding. && Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
